title: Revert is much slower than close and reopen in java editor
description: When I answer 'no' to the 'do you want to save changes' dialog and then double click on the file in the navigator to reopen it, the file is reopened quickly without any delay. However, if I repeat these steps and then select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor, it takes approximately 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original file contents. This delay seems odd, as reverting the file contents should not take longer than simply closing and reopening the file.
OB: When I select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor, it takes approximately 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original file contents.
EB: Reverting the file contents should not take more time than closing and reopening the file.
SR:
1. Open a file in the java editor. 
2. Make some changes to the file. 
3. Do not save the changes when prompted. 
4. Close the file. 
5. Double click on the file in the navigator to reopen it. 
6. Observe that the file is reopened quickly without any delay. 
7. Repeat steps 1-5. 
8. Select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor. 
9. Observe that it takes approximately 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original file contents.
